stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes a disadvantage of creating a series of protected habitats in an effort to maintain biodiversity in an area?
choicesHtml: Threatened or endangered animal populations can grow in size until the populations cannot be supported by the habitat.
Populations within the protected habitats become too genetically diverse, leading to speciation.
Climate change can lead to habitat loss because of changes in temperature and precipitation in an area.
Protected habitats often separate species inside the habitat from other populations of the same species living outside the habitat.
